Title: Data Analyst (m/f)
HTML:
A Prosegur é uma Empresa Multinacional que actua no sector da Segurança Privada, ocupando uma posição de liderança no seu sector.

Na fase atual, pretende identificar um profissional que reportará à Direção de Fidelização e Produtividade com o seguinte perfil:



🔔 Data Analyst (m/f)🔔

Lisboa



👉PRINCIPAIS ATIVIDADES:

  • Desenhar, construir e gerir ferramentas de automatização e visualização de dados, modelos de negócio e segmentação de cliente;
  • Interpretar dados e analisar resultados utilizando modelos estatísticos;
  • Definir Key Business Users e implementar soluções;
  • Analisar diferentes Data Sets e identificar oportunidades para promover soluções com impacto positivo no negócio;
  • Contribuir ativamente para uma cultura Data Driven;
  • Controlar ações e campanhas cliente, com calculo ROI, Cohort, Churn e controlo de resultados.



🔎 PROCURAMOS:

  • Formação em áreas com foco quantitativo como: Engenharias, Economia, Finanças, Computer Science, Matemática ou Estatística;
  • Experiência comprovada em funções similares;
  • Conhecimentos Técnicos: Microsoft Power BI, ETL, Data Modeling. SQL Databases (valorizado);
  • Experiência com Indicadores de fidelização (valorizada);
  • Forte Orientação para o Cliente;
  • Capacidade analítica, de organização, planeamento e tomada de decisão;
  • Boa comunicação e gosto por trabalho em equipa.



🚩 OFERECEMOS:

  • Integração numa empresa Multinacional líder no setor em que atua, numa equipa jovem e dinâmica;
  • Formação Inicial e Contínua.



📣 Faz a tua candidatura!📣


Vem pertencer à Equipa Prosegur e fazer parte do Crescimento e Desenvolvimento deste Negócio!!


Alvarás 248 A e C do MAI

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Asana Marketing team is responsible for fueling business growth and building a brand customers love. We continue to grow our global team focused on revenue and field marketing, advertising, brand and content creation, and lifecycle marketing. We’re looking for a talented and driven Senior Data Analyst to help us build foundational infrastructure for marketing to help power our next wave of growth.

The Marketing Analytics team is passionate about using data to help make better decisions and serve insights with strategic implications. As a Senior Data Analyst on the newly formed Marketing Data Foundations sub team, you will work on the entire marketing analytics lifecycle, including developing foundational metrics and dashboards, defining measurement methodologies, and leveraging data to drive key strategic decisions. You’ll work in a cross-functional environment with product, sales, data science, business technology, and other analysts to build infrastructure that helps marketers understand and influence Asana’s growth, create KPIs that measure and monitor our progress against business-critical goals, and perform ad hoc analysis diving into the impact of individual campaigns, investments, and initiatives

This role is based in our Warsaw office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays. Working from home on Fridays depends on the type of work you do, and your recruiter can share more about the in-office requirements.

Our employees in Poland are employed under a contract of employment.

What you’ll achieve:


Work cross-functionally with teams across Marketing and Enterprise Tech to identify and address analytics tracking, tooling, attribution modeling, and infrastructure challenges
Develop a deep understanding of available data and how they can be used for different analyses to answer questions and solve problems
Lead the design and implementation of marketing data infrastructure and dashboards to enable self serve insights and KPI reporting
Drive interpretation, socialization, and adoption of analytics insights
Identify gaps in our marketing funnel and surface opportunities for improvement
Identify opportunities for process automation and efficiency improvements
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to team skill development


About you:


4 or more years of experience in analytics or data related roles, preferably with exposure to Marketing data and systems.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related technical field.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets.
Ability to think big picture and identify change impact for complex data systems.
Data visualization and dashboarding experience using Tableau, Looker, or similar.
Able to initiate and execute projects independently.
Passion for dealing with ambiguous problems
Familiarity with Marketing tools (Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Salesforce, Marketo, Iterable etc.) or similar tools a plus.
Fluency in English and excellent communication skills.


At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

What we’ll offer:


Generous, transparent and fair compensation system.
Contract of Employment (and the option of 50% tax deductible costs for author’s rights usage in respect of applicable roles).
Health insurance with dental and travel coverage (Lux Med).
Meals reimbursement on the days that you work from the office.
Career growth budget
Home office setup budget
Gym/Fitness reimbursement
Fertility healthcare and family-forming support with Carrot
Mental Health Support in Modern Health
Group life insurance
MacBooks with all necessary accessories


For this role, the estimated base salary range is between 20 800 - 26 500 PLN gross per month (subject to all taxes and necessary deductions). The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed rang e above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.

In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity and sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.

About Us

Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor’s and Inc.’s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a leading Irish organisation looking to hire a Data Analyst. The company offer a hybrid working model with 2 days onsite and 3 days working remotely. For the initial probation period it will however be onsite while the person learns the systems and processes. They will provide a salary of €50,000 (max) + a generous benefits package.




As there is a little need to travel to the Northern Ireland office to work on occasion, only consider EU citizens can be considered for the role.




Primary Duties




• Profitability, market & data analysis

• Work closely with the sales team to understand customer behaviour

• Take a lead in improving data driven processes




Requirements




• Experience in Data Analytics

• Experience with Visualisation with PowerBI or similar and good excel skills

• Excellent communication skills




On Offer




• The client will provide a salary of €50,000 + benefits

• Hybrid working, 2 days onsite, 3 days remote

• Fantastic opportunities for career progression




Apply now by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Even if the job isn't quite right but you are looking for something similar, please get in touch




Why Apply Through Sigmar?




· Gain access to exclusive roles that are not advertised elsewhere

· We’ll help manage your job hunt, strengthen your interview skills and tidy up your CV

· We’ll provide you with an overview of the jobs market within your industry and help you tailor your jobs search

• Profitability, market & data analysis

• Work closely with the sales team to understand customer behaviour

• Take a lead in improving data driven processes


Requirements


• Experience in Data Analytics

• Experience with Visualisation with PowerBI or similar and good excel skills

• Excellent communication skills


On Offer


• The client will provide a salary of €50,000 + benefits

• Hybrid working, 2 days onsite, 3 days remote

• Fantastic opportunities for career progression


Apply now by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Even if the job isn't quite right but you are looking for something similar, please get in touch


Why Apply Through Sigmar?


· Gain access to exclusive roles that are not advertised elsewhere

· We’ll help manage your job hunt, strengthen your interview skills and tidy up your CV

· We’ll provide you with an overview of the jobs market within your industry and help you tailor your jobs search

Title: Analista de datos-Power BI
Description:
¡Diseña el futuro de la tecnología con nosotros! 🌟




En Wordlgrid, buscamos un/a analista de datos con experiencia contrastada en Power BI con pasión por crear soluciones innovadoras y escalables en entornos de vanguardia. 🚀.




📍 Ubicación: Madrid, Sevilla, Barcelona, Santander




¿Qué buscamos?




Responsabilidades:




Soporte a usuarios:

Atención al buzón de soporte y atención a usuarios para la herramienta de gestión de activos en servicio SAGA
Catalogación de la información recibida en el buzón
Primera capa de soporte a usuarios ante dudas de proceso, parametrización de datos y soporte general a usuarios.
Modificación/corrección de datos para resolución de dudas/incidencias de usuarios.
Reportes periódicos (semanales) de los indicadores anteriores, identificando temática, emisor, encargado de gestión de la incidencia/petición, grado de avance y adherencia al estándar de atención objetivo.
Mantenimiento de documentación (guías/manuales/píldoras formativas...) de ayuda a los usuarios de las aplicaciones.
Soporte en la realización de presentaciones y documentos.




Analisis y seguimiento:

Creación y mantenimiento de cuadros de mando y reporte en herramientas de BI (PowerBI, QuickSight,etc).




Seguimiento y aseguramiento de la parametrización coordinada de las aplicaciones, tales como:

-Parametrización de NdAs vs catálogos de avisos en SAP.

-Parametrización de NdAs vs hojas de ruta en SAP.

-Parametrización de NdAs vs unidades físicas

-Hojas de ruta vs catálogos de avisos.

-Coordinación de datos con la plataforma de gestión de descargos

-Coordinación de datos con Ágora

Diseño e implantación de las métricas de control de los procesos, tales como:

-Seguimiento de la creación de OT sin pasar por NdAs

-Seguimiento de la gestión de las NdAs, coherencia y validación en plazo

-Depuración de datos en el proceso de gestión de NdAs y creación de OT

-Análisis de indicadores identificados en auditoria y reporte

-Lanzamiento manual y monitorización del proceso de creación de OT - SAP desde trabajos en

SAGA.




Estudio analítica avanzada:

Elaboración de estudios de analítica avanzada para soporte a los estudios de negocio tales como:

-Estudios analíticos de correlación de variables para la mejora de modelos de predicción en gestión de activos.

-Análisis de comportamiento de variables de negocio para definición de estrategias de gestión.




Se contempla también el soporte en la mejora de procesos e identificación de oportunidades de mejora.




Requisitos:

Ingeniero Técnico o Grado -- Industrial, Informático o equivalente.
Power BI (mínimo 3 años de experiencia)
QuickSight (mínimo 3 años de experiencia)
SAP R3 y HANA
SQL gestión de BBDD
Administración de bases de datos relacionales
COGNOS
BW




Competencias Personales:

Proactividad, flexibilidad e iniciativa.
Capacidad organizativa
Trabajo en equipo: Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios, incluidos desarrolladores, arquitectos y especialistas en seguridad.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Remuneración competitiva y beneficios atractivos.
Planes de formación extensivos para fomentar el desarrollo profesional.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (porque sabemos lo importante que es la flexibilidad).
Oportunidades de crecimiento a largo plazo en una empresa global.
Flexibilidad para equilibrar tu vida profesional y personal.
Proyectos desafiantes en un entorno global.




Si estás listo/a para liderar la creación de soluciones que marcan la diferencia, queremos conocerte. 🙌




Haz de 2025 el año en que tu talento brille al máximo con nosotros. 💡✨

Title: Data Analyst (Data Visualization)
Description:
Title: Data Analyst (Data Visualization)

Location: Barcelona

Length of Contract: Permanent contract




Haybury are working with a global Biotech as they seek a talented and creative Data Analyst who has experience delivery data visualization within Tableau. This is an exciting opportunity whereby you will be delivering key data visualization to global stakeholders to support the decision making process.




The ideal candidate will have experience within data analytics and working with snowflake to develop key business insights using Tableau to achieve this. Alongside this you will also have experience working with front end data to create data visualization







Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain interactive Tableau dashboards and reports to visualize complex data in a clear, actionable way
Translate business requirements into impactful, user-friendly visualizations tailored to various stakeholder groups
Work with cross functional teams to ensure all data is accurately collected for visualization tasks
Analyze and interpret front-facing datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Act as the primary point of contact for data visualization and Tableau-related requests
Gather requirements and feedback from end-users to iterate and improve dashboard functionality and relevance
Deliver data analytics and Data visualization reports and dashboards to global stakeholders







Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Analytics, Data Science or a closely related field
3+ years' Data Analysis experience
3+ years experience creating data Visualization within Tableau
3+ years working with snowflake
Experience in pharmaceuticals is a bonus




Feel free to reach out to Rory.Pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential conversation or feel free to reach out via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst (Rif. 2025-136)
Description:
aizoOn, società di consulenza tecnologica di innovazione, indipendente, che opera a livello globale ricerca un / a Data Analyst.




Il / La candidato / a verrà inserito / a nella Divisione di Mercato Transportation di aizoOn ed opererà per un nostro importante cliente multinazionale Automotive nel ruolo di Data Analyst.




Nell’ambito di dati provenienti da finance, gestione contratti e telemetria veicolare, si occuperà dell’analisi di questi ultimi e della generazione di reportistica, interagendo con le varie aree IT e con il Business.




PROFILO




Laurea in discipline tecnico-scientifiche
2-3 anni di esperienza in ambito data analysis e software development
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata (minimo B2)
Precisione e capacità analitiche
Ottime capacità comunicative







COMPETENZE TECNICHE




Esperienza consolidata nell’utilizzo di SQL
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di Python
Ottima padronanza nell'utilizzo di Excel
Conoscenza di servizi REST API
Conoscenza di cloud services, principalmente AWS




Da considerarsi un plus la conoscenza di DB no SQL e Power BI







The job search refers to candidates of both genders

Title: Data Scientist/Analyst
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Our team is looking for a Data Scientist to help us understand and improve our Personalisation platform at PlayStation. We are on a mission to deliver world-class Personalised experiences across the PlayStation Network, and we need your help to support our data-driven approach, run robust experiments, and surface key insights from our user data. If you are curious, analytical, and love digging into data, we want you on our team.

What you'll be doing:


Support analytical work across our Personalisation program, helping evaluate how users engage with our personalised experiences.
Partner with senior data scientists, engineers, and product managers to design and evaluate A/B tests and other experiments.
Collaborate with engineering teams to understand how our systems work and provide input on how to develop our products with a data-first approach
Participate in the development of experimentation plans, making sure we have quality data which leads to useful results
Help analyse and interpret experiment results, turning complex findings into clear summaries and business insights.
Assist with creation of dashboards, reports, and visualizations that support ongoing learning and decision-making.
Work with data teams across the company to ensure we have the right data and tools to support personalisation analytics.


What we are looking for:


A degree, or equivalent experience, in Statistics, Computer or Data Science, Mathematics, Analytics, or similar
2-3+ years in a role providing data analytics, business intelligence, data science, or similar.
Hands-on experience supporting experiments or A/B testing in a product environment.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and working with large datasets.
Working knowledge of Python, R, or similar languages for data analysis.
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A curious mindset and passion for learning about user behaviour and data.
Familiarity with e-commerce or personalization systems is a plus


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Title: Jr Analyst, Data and Insights
Description:
Job Purpose

We are now looking for a Junior Reporting Analyst to join our Data Insights Services Team. The role provides insightful, accurate and timely operational and performance reporting, and analysis to stakeholders within the European Business Units. The role offers an opportunity to work within a high-performing team focused on delivering timely and quality standard reporting, ad-hoc analysis and design of new reports.

The activities of the Data Insights Services Teams are aimed to support the decision-making process of the commercial and supply chain business units, to ultimately accelerate business performance for CCEP.

The successful candidate will combine strong analytical skills and ability to collaborate effectively and drive efficiency/continuous improvement. Curiosity about data and BI tools is essential, as well as strong communication skills.

Key Responsibilities


Prepare and distribute standard reports using BI tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) and MS Excel based on requests from the stakeholders in an accurate and timely manner.
Extract, cleanse and validate the necessary data from the relevant systems required to produce reports.
Document report processes within the team in a standard way.
Investigates issues or performs advanced validations with senior assistance.
Work with agreed deadlines for delivering regular reports and activities to business stakeholders.
Support the implementation of Continuous Improvement initiatives.
Work in Agile environment which is characterized by flexibility, collaboration, iterative progress, and swift response to changes.
Build strong relationships with key internal stakeholders to support the execution of reporting activities and help on resolving any reporting and data issues.


Requirements


Degree level education in Information Systems, Finance or Business Studies
Min 1 year of relevant experience in a dynamic environment such as a multinational organization or a Shared Services Centre
Basic understanding of financial systems & processes


Skills which will be considered an advantage:


MS Office Suite Skills, especially Excel (including pivot tables, charts etc.), PowerPoint - intermediate
Prior experience with Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx and/or other BI tools
ERP experience, preferably SAP – Basic/Intermediate
Salesforce (or another CRM tool) – Basic/Intermediate


Behavioural competencies preferred


Analytical skills
Customer-oriented mindset
Communication skills
Structured and organized
Can-do attitude
Adaptability and flexibility
Attention to details
Other – responsible, self-motivated individual


Language capability


English – Advanced

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europe’s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. You’ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

  • Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.


You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.




Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.


We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!



We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.


We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission at Qwello is to revolutionize the charging industry, we are committed to turn the world from combustion to electric. We design, build and operate charging infrastructure for the public space. We excel in simplicity, user focus and engineering excellence. We value diversity of thought, background and approaches and foster a culture of belonging. We understand that the best products are built by excellent teams, not individual superstars. Be part of shaping the E-mobility of the future!

Qwello acquired Park&Charge in 2024 and we now operate in the Netherlands under the name Park&Charge (for more info visit www.parkncharge.nl). To reach our goal, we are looking for a Data Analyst who will help us analyze data to drive operational improvements and support strategic decisions.

As a Data Analyst, you will work with data to provide insights that optimize our charging station operations, forecast demand, and improve processes. You will play a key role in ensuring data integrity, collaborating across teams, and supporting business growth through data-driven solutions.

Only candidates with fluent Dutch will be considered for this position, please refrain from applying if you do not meet this requirement.




Your Responsibilities 🚀
Support the team to deliver data analyses and data visualizations to steer the development of relevant metrics and the discovery of business opportunities.
Use data modeling techniques to forecast demand and customer behavior.
Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into key performance indicators and business performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify relevant data, and implement data-driven solutions.
Contribute to the development of existing ETLs to optimize the reliability and profitability of our growing fleet.





Your Profile ✨
Bachelor's or master’s degree in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, social science research, or similar field.
Strong knowledge of data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and confidence with Python scripting.
Ability to extract insights from raw data and understand database architecture, data landscapes, and warehouses.
Strong analytical skills to identify problems, analyze data, and provide valuable insights within organizational and industry contexts.
Proactive approach to problem-solving with a result focused attitude. 
The ability to work in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment.
Willingness to take initiative, and to ensure high quality standards.
Fluency in both written and verbal Dutch and English.





Your Benefits 🪴
Flat hierarchies with an efficient decision-making processes without red tape.
The opportunity to play a key role in shaping the mobility revolution.
Be part of an international and dynamic team of more than 35 nationalities.
Enjoy a remote-friendly environment with  flexible options, you choose whether to work entirely from home, in one of our offices or a mix that suits you and you have the possibility of workation within the EU, plus 30 vacation days.
Regular company and team events outside of the office to disconnect from our computers and reconnect with colleagues on hikes, mountain e-bike tours, offsites and more.
Personal and professional development through in-house lunch & learn sessions, collaborative coding challenge discussions, as well as externally provided training, courses and conferences.








Equal Opportunities:

We strive to eliminate discrimination,  remove barriers and ensure equal opportunity through a transparent recruitment process. We are fully committed to fostering an inclusive and respectful work environment where everyone can succeed.  At Park&Charge everyone is welcomed regardless of cultural background, creed, race, sexual orientation, colour or  gender expression.

Title: Data Analyst - Visualización & Negocio (Barcelona)
Description:
Únete a nosotros y forma parte del futuro de BCNC Group🚀




Somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, Reino Unido, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos. #WeHaveOurOwnCode




🔍Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en visualización de datos con enfoque en la generación de valor a negocio a través del análisis de datos trabajando codo a codo con las áreas estratégicas en una empresa referente del sector servicios con gran volumen de usuarios.




✨Qué harás en tu día a día:

Diseñar y construir dashboards claros, visuales y útiles que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Generar storytelling con datos, facilitando la interpretación de la información para las áreas de negocio.
Colaborar de forma estrecha con el Product Owner y con los equipos comerciales y de operaciones, entendiendo sus procesos y retos.
Proponer mejoras y accionables a partir de los datos disponibles.
Promover buenas prácticas en el uso y consumo de la información, con mirada crítica y enfoque en la mejora continua.




✨Qué aspectos claves esperamos de ti:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como analista de datos en proyectos recientes.
Dominio de herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Colaboración estrecha con equipos de negocio para comprender necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones visuales. Se valora capacidad analítica, sentido visual y orientación a la claridad en los datos.
Proactividad y orientación al impacto: no buscamos solo alguien que entregue dashboards, sino que aporte valor desde el análisis.
Trabajo en entornos ágiles (Scrum) y equipos multidisciplinares.




✨Que tenemos para ti:

🤝Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

👩‍💻Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

⌚Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

✨Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

📖Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

🤩Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

🌴Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

🙌🏻Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




Y sobre todo… un buen entorno laboral: nuestros colaboradores puntúan un 4.7 sobre 5 su experiencia en BCNC Group!




Te queremos conocer...

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
There are NO limits to your career: come shape the future and be part of a truly unique global culture at OutSystems!

About This Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to transform data, reports, and analysis into business insights, as a crucial support to OutSystems’ decision-making fueled by Data. As such, this means someone who executes with technical acumen and data products mindset, strives to understand challenges using a business perspective and effectively collaborates with others.

You will be part of the Data Science and Analytics team, at the heart of the decision-making at OutSystems, with a special focus on our Go-to-Market strategies. Besides partnering with company stakeholders, you will collaborate within a broader Data Area that covers Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Data platform management, and Analytics Enablement.

You should have strong foundations in Data Analysis and reporting, evidence critical reasoning and the ability to derive conclusions from Data. OutSystems data lake is large and covering multiple dimensions, and you must be able to navigate it and collaborate with others to extract the most of it.

What You Will Do Or Key Responsibilities


Craft compelling and impactful data visualizations, interactive dashboards, data narratives to communicate complex analysis results and insights.
Create and maintain BI reporting based on a variety of systems and data, leveraging technology to scale the team’s efforts, increasing efficiency and output using data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Shiny;
Conduct Advanced Data Analysis and modeling, while guaranteeing the quality of data for analyses;
Work with stakeholders to understand their real business needs, acting as a Strategic Advisor to the business.
Collaborate with Data Engineering and Architecture to design and optimize our data lake, to enable more efficient analyses and Analytics Self-Service solutions


Qualifications / What You Need To Succeed (Hiring manager provides)


2+ years experience as a Data Analyst;
MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science Informatics (or a related field) or equivalent experience;
Experience working with at least one visual BI analytical tool (Power BI preferential);
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL;
Knowledge of R or Python programming language for data analysis. Experience with Shiny is a plus;
Critical thinking: explore data, identify trends and come to new conclusions based on findings, in a business focused way;
Communication skills: empathy and active listening; good presentation skills with clear speaking, easily communicating complex ideas;
Collaborate with a cross-functional team (Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Data platform management, and Analytics Enablement).


The Longer Story

OutSystems is a global leader transforming how companies innovate through software, empowering IT leaders with a better way to build the software that matters most.We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in helping companies solve some of their most strategic business challenges, from modernizing their workplace processes to transforming their employee and customer experiences. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that is a low-code market leader and preferred by professional developers around the world.

OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 800,000 developer community members, 1,700 employees, more than 500 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 75 countries and across 21 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Portugal, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, India, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.

Working at OutSystems

Our goal is to ensure that OutSystems is a place for bright, happy, and motivated people who share a common purpose and take pride in excellent work towards our vision. Our culture is focused on building agility at scale, which allows us to operate with a high drive in a competitive market. In our federation of teams culture, if we have every team operating like a startup, we can all learn, grow, and innovate while having the space to be proactive and creative. We encourage our team members to collaborate, focus on results, act quickly, understand our business, and adopt a growth mindset.

What do we have to offer you?


A company that continues to grow, change, and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills.
Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you – and a team that is global.
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
We “Ask Why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way.


Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we’d love to hear from you!

OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law.

Join us in disrupting the status quo of the low-code market, we give you the power to "Ask Why", you give our customers the power to innovate through software!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

We're looking for a Junior Data Analyst to support our Planning & Performance team in the Nordics and Baltics on a temporary contract until the end of 2025. If you're a detail-driven data enthusiast with a flair for simplifying processes and turning numbers into insights, this is your chance to make an impact.


Own daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc KPI reporting
Act as the go-to expert (SPOC) for our Business Intelligence tools
Maintain visuals for the monthly forecasting cycle
Update and enhance Planning & Performance scorecards
Support the Nordics & Baltics Pilot service level project
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and reporting requirements
Validate data, troubleshoot issues, and drive simplification and automation of processes


About you


2+ years of experience in planning, logistics, or data analysis (FMCG industry preferred)
Strong analytical skills and advanced Excel proficiency
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Power BI is a plus)
Familiarity with DAX language is advantageous
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset
Organized, structured, and capable of managing multiple priorities
Experience with cross-functional or project-based work
Fluent in English


About us OUR BENEFITSAt Danone we strive to have variety of benefits across our region in Nordics & Baltics and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.


Salary of 1700 - 2100 euro gross per month, depending on the candidates experience;
Health insurance from first working day;
Access to sports and wellness program;
One share for all allowing to become co-owner of Danone;
Remote work opportunities;
Unlimited access to our online learning platforms and other amazing opportunities for your professional development;
Organization and Team events.


And hey, want a snack? Feel free to grab a yoghurt in the fridge at the office - products available all day! ABOUT DANONEDanone's mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we believe in order to do so we need a healthy planet. We have more than 100 000 employees worldwide built on three business categories Dairy and Drinks, Plant-Based Products and Specialized Nutrition who all strive for our vision One Planet One Health.Danone Nordics & Baltics has 500 employees, and our brand portfolio includes many trusted brands such as Alpro, Aptamil, Souvenaid, Fortimel, Neocate, Lophlex, Actimel, Aqua dOr, Fortini and Milupa.We develop healthy food choices for everyone and grow strong brands through close collaboration with our customers and consumers. We keep challenging ourselves to stay one step ahead of emerging trends and tastes. Join our movement for a more sustainable world. One Planet One Health BY YOUDid you know that as a B-Corp certified company, Danone meets the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability?For more information about Danone, our teams and culture, please explore careers.danone.com. TO APPLYClick APPLY button and send in your application in English before the closing date of May 15th. Recruitment process is ongoing, and we will review applications and conduct interviews continuously. Observe that the position may be filled before last application date.We are proud to be an equal employer. We are convinced our differences make the difference and that an inclusive working environment will drive our growth as a business, as teams and as individuals. We will therefore consider all applicants for employment* fostering an inclusive working culture that is accessible for all.* all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.SIA Nutricia with its registered office in Riga (Gustava Zemgala gatve 74, Riga, LV-1039, Latvia) is the controller of your personal data disclosed in the profile and in documents submitted during the recruitment process.

We are convinced our differences make the difference and that an inclusive working environment will drive our growth as a business, as teams and as individuals. Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.




Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.




You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.




Why Working With Us?

Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.




Our Values

Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.




Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Interesting, thriving industry
Opportunity to grow
Competitive benefits and career development
Finish at 1:30pm through summer!




This Data Analyst position is with a organisation operating in the financial sector. The role offers long-term career stability and a structured growth path. The organisation places a strong emphasis on data-driven decision-making, supporting its strategic goals and fostering a data-centric culture.




This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals seeking to develop their expertise in the AML and risk management space, while working with an organisation dedicated to enhancing its data-driven capabilities. As a Data Analyst, you will contribute to the overall operations of the team through data analysis, visualisation, and reporting.




You’ll work on:

Data quality, analysis, and BI dashboarding (Power BI).
Developing AML risk models.
Applying statistical methods using R/Python.
Communicating insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Skills/Experience:

Experience in data analysis and visualisation
Proficiency in R/Python, SQL, and statistical methods.
Strong communication skills.
University Degree or Diploma (MQF 5 or above)




Salary / Remuneration:

Starting salary of €37k with guaranteed annual increments
Performance Bonus: Up to 15% of annual basic salary
Disturbance Allowance: Up to 15% of base salary for additional task-based hours
Group Health & Life Insurance
Summer Hours - Finish at 1:30pm!




For more information, contact Beau Brown confidentially on +356 2601 6602 or email your CV to beau.brown@archer.com.mt




I specialise in recruiting for data and analytics roles, so if you would like to discuss this or other similar opportunities, please feel free to reach out.




For more opportunities, visit: https://archer.com.mt/candidates/




About Archer – Archer IT Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment Consultancy based in Malta.

Title: Werkstudent Business Data Analyst
Description:
Werkstudent Business Data Analyst bei Knuddels GmbH & Co. KG

Anforderungen

Wohnsitz: Nur für Bewerber aus Deutschland

Sprache: Deutsch - Muttersprachliches Niveau


Du absolvierst gerade ein laufendes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs
Du besitzt sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL
Du besitzt mindestens gute Kenntnisse in Excel/Google Sheets und Python
Du verfügst über ein sehr gutes Zahlenverständnis
Du hast Freude am analytischen Denken
Du hast eine Leidenschaft für die Auswertung großer Datenmengen in Datenbanken und Google Sheets / Excel
Du hast idealerweise Vorkenntnisse in Java und kannst diese in deine Arbeit einbringen
Idealerweise hast du Kenntnisse im Testing und weißt schon was ein A/B-Test ist und wie man ihn auswertet


Tätigkeiten


Du erstellst Analysen aus vorhandenen Daten, die du vornehmlich mit SQL abfragst in Excel/ Google Sheets und Python
Du erstellst und trainierst Machine Learning Modelle
Du leitest Handlungsempfehlungen und strategische Entscheidungen zur Optimierung unseres Produkts auf Grundlage der gewonnenen Erkenntnisse ab und hast dabei auch immer im Blick, dass die benötigten Daten korrekt und vollständig vorliegen
Du berätst unsere Product Manager anhand deiner Analysen zur Vorbereitung von Tests und Features
Du verbesserst gegebenenfalls unseren nächtlichen Reload zum Datensammeln unter Einsatz von Java und SQL


Team

Wir sind ein tatkräftiges Team aus 56 Personen, darunter 25 Entwickler*innen. Wir haben ein sehr gutes Betriebsklima, unser Team besteht aus ganz vielen unterschiedlichen Charakteren (grob gesagt: Nerds und Nerd Compensators), die agil zusammenarbeiten und offen miteinander kommunizieren.

Über das Unternehmen

Seit 1999 bringt unsere Chat-Plattform Menschen näher zusammen

Mit mehr als 300.000 monatlich aktiven Mitgliedern in mehr als 1.000 aktiven Chaträumen sind wir Deutschlands größte Chat-Community. In einer schnelllebigen und stark umkämpften Branche können wir nur bestehen, weil uns Werte wie Offenheit, Vielfalt und Inklusion am Herzen liegen und wir ein klasse Team sind. Unser gemeinsames Ziel ist es, ein herausragendes Produkt zu schaffen, das unsere Mitglieder bewegt und begeistert.

Klicke auf "Bewerben" für Details zu den Benefits, dem Team und dem Bewerbungsprozess.

Title: Data Analyst (Seller Experience Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Marketplace, Seller Experience Team)

The Data Analyst – Seller Experience will play a central role in driving data-informed decisions across the entire Seller Experience division at eMAG. This role goes beyond a traditional reporting function; it is a strategic partner embedded directly in the product and experience organization. The analyst will support multiple verticals including seller onboarding, acquisition channels, performance monitoring, funnel optimization, UI/UX governance, and A/B testing initiatives.

Working closely with product managers, UX, content, comms, and seller support teams, the analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining dashboards, conducting deep-dive analyses, and helping define KPIs that drive product prioritization and continuous improvement. This includes support across both web and mobile surfaces, as well as strategic initiatives like rating systems, personalization frameworks, and educational tools for sellers.

The role requires a balance of strong technical skills (SQL, data visualization, experimentation methods) and a good understanding of product dynamics. The analyst is expected to translate large volumes of raw data into insights that are easy to understand, actionable, and aligned with the annual OKRs of the division, reviewed monthly.




What You’ll Have To Do

Partner with Product Managers, UX Designers, and other stakeholders to define, monitor, and evolve product KPIs across all seller-facing surfaces (e.g., dashboard, mobile app, onboarding flows, CRM).
Design and maintain self-service dashboards that support day-to-day decision-making across the Seller Experience division.
Analyze behavioral data to uncover insights on seller engagement, feature adoption, friction points, and drop-off across funnels.
Build tracking plans and collaborate with developers to ensure consistent and reliable event instrumentation across platforms.
Own the end-to-end analysis lifecycle for major initiatives: define the hypothesis, pull and validate the data, analyze trends, and present actionable recommendations.
Conduct A/B test analysis to validate the impact of new features or experience changes, ensuring statistical rigor and clear communication of results.
Identify data quality issues, propose solutions, and work with engineering or data teams to address inconsistencies or gaps.
Provide ongoing support to quarterly OKRs and monthly performance reviews by delivering insights that shape prioritization and roadmap adjustments.
Contribute to the creation of a shared understanding of seller behavior across teams by building consistent reporting layers and documentation.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve how data is captured, structured, visualized, and used in decision-making across the division.




What makes you a good fit:

Experience And Background

3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Product Analyst role, preferably in a digital product or eCommerce environment.
Proven ability to work with product and cross-functional teams to generate actionable insights that drive measurable outcomes.
Experience supporting product discovery, feature rollout, and UX iteration cycles through structured analysis.

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in SQL (e.g., BigQuery, PostgreSQL, or similar) for data extraction, transformation, and performance analysis.
Experience building and maintaining dashboards in BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with product analytics tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Google Analytics for behavior tracking and funnel analysis.
Ability to design and interpret A/B tests; understanding of statistical significance, test design, and experimentation platforms.
Experience working with large datasets, joining across multiple sources (e.g., CRM, product logs, feedback platforms).
Comfortable working with data in Google Sheets, Excel, or Python (optional but a plus).

Analytical Thinking and Business Context

Ability to transform vague questions into structured analysis plans, and raw data into clear business narratives.
Solid understanding of metrics frameworks: DAU, MAU, conversion rates, retention curves, NPS, engagement ratios, etc.
Experience defining KPIs and building metric hierarchies for product dashboards, funnels, or seller engagement.
High attention to detail when validating data quality or interpreting trends.
Understanding of marketplace dynamics and multi-stakeholder ecosystems is a strong plus.

Communication and Collaboration

Able to communicate complex data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience working alongside Product Managers, UX Designers, and Content/Support teams to iterate on solutions.
Strong documentation skills: analysis notes, dashboards, tracking plans, etc.
Proactive and self-driven: able to push analysis forward even when requirements are not fully defined.

What Makes You Stand Out

Familiarity with experimentation platforms (e.g., Optimizely, Google Optimize, or in-house testing tools).
Prior experience supporting B2B platforms or seller/vendor interfaces.
Understanding of UI/UX data modeling or behavioral analytics.
Exposure to Python or dbt for data modeling is a plus.

Growth Opportunities

This role offers the opportunity to grow as a strategic analytical partner across one of eMAG’s most dynamic product areas. As the Seller Experience division continues to evolve, the Data Analyst will be well-positioned to deepen their impact and accelerate their career growth through:

Domain Ownership: Ability to progressively own specific verticals (e.g., onboarding, mobile seller app, performance tools) and become the go-to expert for data-driven decisions in that space.
Strategic Influence: Increased participation in quarterly planning, OKR setting, and roadmap validation by shaping how data is used to assess opportunity, risk, and performance.
Methodological Depth: Development in areas such as experimentation design, segmentation models, retention analysis, or funnel diagnostics—based on business needs and personal interest.
Cross-Divisional Exposure: Opportunities to support or collaborate with teams outside Seller Experience, such as Platform, Fulfillment, or Buyer Experience, depending on project scope.
Path to Seniority: Clear growth path toward a Senior Data Analyst role or hybrid Product-Data role, depending on profile and performance.
Professional Development: Access to training resources, cross-team learning, and potential mentorship by senior analysts in the centralized Data & AI function.

This role is ideal for a data-driven professional who thrives in fast-paced, product-focused environments and wants to make a real impact on how sellers interact with one of the largest eCommerce platforms in the region. The Data Analyst – Seller Experience will work at the intersection of user behavior, product strategy, and performance optimization, turning complex data into simple, actionable insights.

We value structured thinking, proactive collaboration, and a strong sense of ownership. You’ll be part of a team where your input will directly shape what gets built, how it's measured, and how success is defined across multiple product surfaces. You’ll work closely with a diverse mix of product managers, designers, and content teams, and be supported by modern tools and a growing analytics culture.

If you're looking for a role where you can influence both the what and the why of product decisions—while continuously sharpening your analytical and business skills—this is the place to grow.

What We’ve Prepared For You

Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

We value structured thinking, proactive collaboration, and a strong sense of ownership. You’ll be part of a team where your input will directly shape what gets built, how it's measured, and how success is defined across multiple product surfaces. You’ll work closely with a diverse mix of product managers, designers, and content teams, and be supported by modern tools and a growing analytics culture.

If you're looking for a role where you can influence both the what and the why of product decisions—while continuously sharpening your analytical and business skills—this is the place to grow.

What We’ve Prepared For You

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




🧐 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOU?

Experience in Data Domain, Data Dictionary, Data Governance.
Expertise (E2 at least) in SQL and preparing medium to high complexity queries. Good to have - exposure to RDBMS, NoSQL, cloud Databases - Redshift/Snowflake as well as flat files - as per real world scenarios.
Data sampling, Data quality analysis, Data Modelling.
Responsible for Data mapping deliverables (Source-to-target mappings) as well as Data dictionary providing a detailed understanding of new product builds.
Adept in analytical abilities to determine root cause for data issues with quick turnaround.
Awareness/Understanding of GDPR and Data encryption best practices and norms followed as per global IT standards.
Familiarity with Aviation domain - is an added advantage. Alternatively quick learner to adapt to Airlines Operations domain terms and terminologies - considering the client landscape.
Provide playback of role specific deliverables to Build teams to provide in depth end to end Data flow understanding for product.
Should have a good balance of business, data and moderate technical understanding - to enable effective stakeholder management.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Lisbon + hybrid work
Work Schedule: 9AM to 6PM




🤝 WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan + Health Insurance).
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡 WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute 🥇

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst internship
Description:
Job Location

Paris

Job Description

Are you energized by solving tough business problems?

Do you have a passion to transform P&G's brand building while enabling better decision-making with cutting (e.g. ranging from Data Science to Behavioral Science)?

If so, then an internship in the Analytics and Insights organization is for you!

The Analytics & Insights team in P&G takes you across a breadth of experiences, on multiple P&G businesses, likely in multiple countries, always with an international perspective, always fast-paced.

It is a unique opportunity to develop both the ever-more demanded Data Science skillset and the strategic thinking needed to manage P&G business.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G’S SUCCESS:


Deliver insights, by using advanced analytics techniques, mining extremely large data sets (the hyped Big Data), and applying best-in-class algorithms developed with/by other Data Scientists, examples could be building models to propose possible scenarios and answer the toughest business questions of the leadership team, optimize algorithms in accuracy and performance to then recommend specific actions to your business partners, discover unknown truths by mining new data sets;
Develop closed-loop experimentation capabilities, to test and learn about key business questions;
Improve the analytical program of your business unit, together with the other functions: design the data strategy for the business unit adopt the right platform and big data technologies.


So, here’s your opportunity! Follow your internship at the Analytics & Insights and help us anticipate what consumers want and find out what they need.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


currently enrolled in a master’s program of a Business/Management Information Systems or Software Development, Information Technology.
Fluent in French and English
Strong IT skills and analytical skills
Strong leadership and communication skills
Able to operate within a business team, in touch with the business and data owners
Execute with excellence
Strong sense of urgency
Can work autonomously
Solid knowledge of Excel


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


Monthly allowance: 1600 EUR/month
Bridge days offered by the company (up to 3 days, depending on the internship period)
Company support for 55% on public transports costs in Paris area or eco mobility support (eg. bike)
Tickets Restaurant card by Edenred (optional)
Company restaurant
Work from Home (1 day per week)
Xmas hamper
Conciergerie services on site
Gym room on site for free
Coupons on our P&G products


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


Encouraging diversity in all its forms, P&G is committed to creating an inclusive work environment and promotes equal opportunities.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000118760

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO WE ARE?

NOEWE group — one of the major professional service providers in the Lithuanian market — offers a portfolio of services in financial planning, legal, tax, business consulting, accounting services, as well as asset and wealth management.




Being a part of the NOEWE group, Management Consulting team offer one-stop-shop services in strategic assistance, and the solutions required for the implementation of these strategies. Every situation is unique. Our task is to understand client's challenges, or in some cases to leverage our experience in order to identify them. And because we are not bound by any conflicts of interest (as global professional service networks are) we always openly share our strategic vision, bold insights and solutions.




📢 We are looking forward to welcome a new Management Consulting team member - Data Analyst to work from our office in Vilnius!




JOIN US IF YOU:

Are smart, result-driven, and have a strong analytical mindset
Have a background in data analysis and statistical methods
Have experience in data visualization and creating insightful reports
Can identify trends, patterns, and insights from complex data sets
Want to help our clients by analyzing data, providing insights, and supporting data-driven decision-making
Are fluent in English and Lithuanian languages




IDEALLY YOU HAVE:

University degree in Data Science, Information Technology​, Mathematics, Economics or similar
Are proficient in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau)​
1-2 years of relevant work experience




OUR INPUT FOR YOUR WELLBEING:

Interesting and diverse experience in the field of management consulting – challenging projects across many different functional areas and industries​
Continuous learning, personal and professional development​
Opportunity to work with top managers and key decision makers​
Opportunity to join forces and become a part of a team of experts​
Friendly, supportive, and exceptional working environment (fresh & new “D9-Artsy office“)
Personalized motivational system (referral bonuses, sick days, additional vacation days, budget for professional training and development, health insurance, etc.)​
Remote work possibility




SALARY

1650-2200 EUR Gross per month




Confidentiality guaranteed. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

When you apply to a job (and / or internship) position, you agree, that the personal data contained in your application (CV) will be processed by Noewe. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing recruitment related activities and will be stored for a period of 3 years in order to contact you about future job / internship opportunities in Lewben group. If you want to withdraw your consent for using your above-mentioned data, please inform us via E-mail: privacy@noewe.eu. For more information how we will process your data and about your rights, please see our policy available at https://noewe.eu/legal-information/privacy-policy/.
