Title: Analyst, Finance & Customer Data
Description:
Harvard Business Publishing (HBP) – the leading destination for innovative management thinking. We reach lifelong learners to improve the practice of management in a changing world. This mission inspires each of us to unlock the leader in everyone – including you!

The opportunity

Harvard Business Publishing Education (HBP Education) partners with educators & learners worldwide by being the richest source of ideas for improving management.

The Analyst, Finance & Customer Data is a member of Higher Education’s Finance & Business Analytics team, bringing a data-driven mindset to analysis and business insights to drive revenue growth for the HE unit. The Analyst will be responsible for building models, reports and analysis of financial and business performance, to derive insights for the Higher Ed business. The Analyst will also partner with the Senior Analyst and Senior Manager to partner with the Enterprise IT, Sales, and Finance teams. Additionally, they will support all efforts to strengthen and expand HE’s data infrastructure and reporting ecosystem.

What You’ll Do


Support the Finance & Business Performance team, by collaborating to design a sustainable approach to how Higher Ed captures, manipulates, and aggregates our various data sources to enable clean and consistent analysis across the group.
Help promote a data-driven culture, provide accessibility to actionable and timely, performance metrics, and enable self-service capabilities for end-users across the business.
Support HE’s analytics tools and backend data systems, including Tableau and Alteryx, and collaborate closely with the Salesforce architecture team to drive alignment with HE’s data and CRM goals.
Engage with the HBP analytics community, to share experiences and incorporate new and better solutions in HE’s ecosystem.
Collaborate with stakeholders in Enterprise IT, Sales, and Finance to effectively deliver on both on-going business and strategic initiatives as well as ad-hoc analysis requests.
Build and expand HE’s suite of dashboards (using Tableau or other tools) used to monitor business performance, including the top-level HE Management Dashboard, Sales dashboards, and dashboards to track HE’s strategic goal and initiatives.
Support insights efforts by employing our full ecosystem of data sources, including financial/transactional data, web analytics, offline data, customer records, industry research, and competitive intelligence.
Translate results into clear actions and insights for decision-makers, utilizing compelling and intuitive visuals, dashboards, and narratives.
Gain a deep understanding of modeling techniques to build solutions that track key revenue drivers and inform recurring forecasts.


What You’ll Bring


3+ years of relevant Finance, Analytics, and/or Business Intelligence experience.
Experience with SQL and other programming language.
Data presentation experience.
Customer-stakeholder personality.
Demonstrated ability to think creatively, work independently, and apply thoughtful analysis to solve business challenges across a variety of functions such as Sales, IT and Finance.


What We Offer

As a mission-driven global company, Harvard Business Publishing is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion, trust, and engagement where everyone is welcome, valued, respected, and feels they belong. In addition to a competitive compensation and benefits package, we offer meaningful programs focused on career development and employee wellness, such as education reimbursement and early-release Summer Fridays!

HBP is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

$85,000K - $95,000K

Above is the annualized pay range for this position. In addition, this position includes the opportunity to earn our annual Performance Based Variable Pay Program. Actual salary will be set based upon a range of factors, including external benchmark market data, individual knowledge, skills, experience, location and internal equity.
Show more

Title: IT Data Analyst I
Description:
Only applicants who are currently near our Andover, MA or Hudson, NH will be considered, as we've received an enormous amount of resumes. Thank you. **


Job Summary

This is a great opportunity for a recent college grad with around 2 years work experience. As a member of the IT Data Team, you will leverage expertise in data analysis techniques and software tools to deliver valuable insights. Collaborate with business stakeholders to define requirements and implement effective solutions within the enterprise data lake.

Job Responsibilities


Analyze business requirements and design/modify data modeling solutions in data warehouse/data lake on AWS
Support critical production environments using various data management/ETL tools including Kafka and MongoDB
Develop SQL queries and Power-BI reports from multiple databases that meet reporting requirements
Document architectures for new or existing solutions
Create AI/ML solutions using cutting-edge cloud technologies like AWS Bedrock


Required Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree (preferably in Computer Science or related field) may have little or no previous professional experience.
Familiarity with programming languages and databases (Java, Python, Oracle, MySQL, SQL)
Solid knowledge of data modeling techniques using SQL with relational databases
Familiarity with structured and unstructured data
Deploying/Running/troubleshooting in a production environment
Familiarity or experience with databases and cloud-based data management technologies such as AWS RDS, AWS Redshift, MongoDB, and/or AWS Quicksite


Preferred Qualifications


2 years of relevant work experience


Location:


This role is on-site and can be out of any of the following Mercury Systems Locations:
Andover, MA
Hudson, NH

This position requires you to be able to obtain a government security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. Citizens.

Why should you join Mercury Systems?

Mercury Systems is a technology company that makes the world a safer, more secure place. We push processing power to the tactical edge, making the latest commercial technologies profoundly more accessible for today's most challenging aerospace and defense missions. From silicon to system scale, Mercury enables customers to accelerate innovation and turn data into decision superiority. Headquartered in Andover, Massachusetts, Mercury employs more than 2,300 people in 24 locations worldwide. To learn more, visit mrcy.com





Our Culture

We are committed to making Mercury a great place to work, no matter where our employees are located. We offer a casual and enjoyable atmosphere that allows employees to learn and grow. We help and care for one another and work as one to achieve results for us and for our customers. We value communication and transparency, and strive to foster two-way dialogue at all levels of the organization. We are committed to lifelong learning, offering comprehensive skills training and tuition reimbursement. Whether you're just starting out on your career journey or you are an experienced professional, it's important to us that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.

To find out more about Why Mercury?, or visit the Mercury Community or find answers to general questions at Mercury FAQs

Mercury Systems is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status.

As an equal opportunity employer, Mercury Systems is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact the number below.

(978) 256-1300

Seeking a Senior Data Analyst to support data validation and integration through SQL and analytical tools.

Key Responsibilities:

Perform data discovery, analysis, and mapping.

Title: Quantitative Trading Analyst
Description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About The Role

THE POSITION

The Global Trading department is seeking to recruit a Quantitative Trading Analyst to work on our Trading Research & Analytics team in Boston.

Wellington Management’s Trading Department Employs Over 60 Traders Globally And Operates In Specialized Teams According To Sectors, Regions, And Products. Our Investment And Trading Activities Are Conducted On An Industry- Leading Internally Developed Software Platform, Which We Believe Creates a Meaningful Competitive Advantage, And Is An Asset To Our Trading Data Strategy. The Trading Research & Analytics Team Is An In-house Team Of Managers And Analysts, Who Oversee The “business” Of The Department And Provide In-depth, Action-oriented Insights Into Our Trading Capabilities And Activities. Some Of The More Focused Projects Include


Profiling our systematic order flows to determine the optimal electronic/algorithmic execution strategy that will minimize the total cost of execution.
Profiling our investment driven order flows to unearth momentum signals that can be incorporated into the pre trade strategizing process for improving outcomes.
Developing a research and reporting infrastructure designed to monitor the performance of systematic strategies and momentum signals to gauge future efficacy.



Responsibilities


Partnering with investors, traders, broker/dealers, and various internal stakeholders to improve overall execution results through innovation, actionable trading research and enhanced decision-making tools.
Designing a Transaction Cost Analysis (TCA) framework for Global Trading that supports our client reporting, best execution, and execution insights.
Working with trading technology, external vendors, and the dealer community on producing a high-quality data environment surrounding the life cycle of a trade.
Understanding equity and/or fixed income market structure trends and how to evolve our electronic trading strategy.



Qualifications

The successful candidate is likely to have:


Personal qualities and values that are consistent with, and would be additive to, Wellington Management's culture.
Self -motivated individual who exhibits ownership in their work with excellent independent decision-making skills and superior judgement.
Creative problem-solver who can work effectively under tight deadlines and other pressures.
Collaborative, team-player.
Experienced programmer, preferably in Python; working knowledge of SQL; familiarity with machine learning, data analysis, and data modeling.
Proven organizational and communication skills with an emphasis on accuracy, concision, and timeliness.
Working knowledge of quantitative tools and technologies used for Transaction Cost Analysis (TCA), order execution and risk management.
Experience in trading workflows and familiarity with financial markets; knowledge of electronic trading platforms and trading systems.
Experience with business intelligence and data visualization software, preferably Tableau would be viewed favorably.
A minimum 3-5 years relevant work experience in the financial services industry.
Strong academic credentials; a Bachelor's degree is required; a graduate degree and/or professional coursework/certifications (or progress toward) would be additive.



Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMWTalentOperations@wellington.com.

Benefits

At Wellington Management, our approach to compensation is designed to help us attract, inspire and retain the best talent in our industry. We strive to pay employees fairly and competitively across all levels and roles. Our approach to compensation considers all aspects of total compensation; all employees are eligible to receive salary, variable compensation, and benefits. The base salary range for this position is:

USD 65,000 - 150,000

This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; role; skills and experience; certifications; and education. This range is an estimate, and further details on salary and total compensation aspects will be shared with candidates during the recruitment process.

Base salary is only one component of Wellington’s total compensation approach. Other rewards may include a discretionary Corporate Bonus and/ or Incentives, if eligible. In addition, we offer a comprehensive and high value benefit package to meet the unique needs of our employees and their families, and we are committed to fostering a flexible work environment that enables employees to thrive personally and professionally. Examples of our benefits include retirement plan, health and wellbeing, dental, vision, and pharmacy coverage, health savings account, flexible spending accounts and commuter program, employee assistance program, life and disability insurance, adoption assistance, back-up childcare, tuition/CFA reimbursement and paid time off (leave of absence, paid holidays, volunteer, sick and vacation time)

About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About The Role

THE POSITION

The Global Trading department is seeking to recruit a Quantitative Trading Analyst to work on our Trading Research & Analytics team in Boston.

Wellington Management’s Trading Department Employs Over 60 Traders Globally And Operates In Specialized Teams According To Sectors, Regions, And Products. Our Investment And Trading Activities Are Conducted On An Industry- Leading Internally Developed Software Platform, Which We Believe Creates a Meaningful Competitive Advantage, And Is An Asset To Our Trading Data Strategy. The Trading Research & Analytics Team Is An In-house Team Of Managers And Analysts, Who Oversee The “business” Of The Department And Provide In-depth, Action-oriented Insights Into Our Trading Capabilities And Activities. Some Of The More Focused Projects Include

  • Profiling our systematic order flows to determine the optimal electronic/algorithmic execution strategy that will minimize the total cost of execution.

Title: Data Analysis and Marketing Intern (SY24-25)
Description:
Dates: April 28 - August 30, 2025 (approximately)

Position Overview

The Office of Family and Community Advancement (OFCA) at Boston Public Schools is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analysis and Marketing Intern to join our team. This role will support OFCA’s mission to foster stronger family and community engagement through data-driven strategies and impactful communication efforts.

Working under the supervision of the Director of Data Analysis, Marketing, and Systems, the intern will assist in collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data to support internal strategy and external communications. The intern will also contribute to marketing and outreach efforts that amplify the voice and work of OFCA throughout the district and community.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Visualization


Conduct routine data analysis using tools such as R-Studio, Excel, Looker Studio, and Power BI to support ongoing initiatives.
Build interactive, internal and external-facing dashboards in Google Looker Studio that track key metrics and promote transparency among stakeholders.
Identify trends and generate meaningful insights to support decision-making and continuous improvement efforts.
Support the development of data visualizations and reports for various stakeholder groups including district leadership, families, and community partners.
Maintain and update high-level dashboards to reflect progress on OFCA’s priority initiatives.


Marketing & Communications


Draft and edit clear, engaging written communications for internal and external audiences, including newsletters, flyers, reports, and presentations.
Collaborate on the creation of innovative marketing strategies to better engage families, partners, and other stakeholders.
Assist in the coordination and execution of marketing campaigns and events.
Ensure all communications are aligned with OFCA’s branding and messaging guidelines.
Participate in stakeholder meetings and presentations; share data findings clearly and effectively.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with a solid understanding of statistical principles and data storytelling.
Proficiency in R-Studio, Google Looker Studio, Google Sheets/Excel, and ideally other data tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Demonstrated experience creating dashboards and using data to support strategic planning or marketing efforts.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to multitask and manage several projects simultaneously.
High attention to detail and a strong commitment to quality.
Self-motivated, with a strong work ethic and ability to take initiative while also following direction.
Creative mindset with a passion for finding new ways to communicate and engage with audiences.


Preferred Qualifications


Current undergraduate or graduate student in fields such as Data Science, Marketing, Business, Public Policy, Education, Communications, or related.
Previous experience in a public sector, education, or nonprofit setting.
Familiarity with Boston communities and a commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion.
Open to candidates or independent contractors in any location


What You’ll Gain


Real-world experience applying data analysis and marketing strategies to meaningful, community-centered work.
Opportunities to present findings and contribute to decision-making processes at a district level.
Exposure to the inner workings of a large urban school system and its engagement strategies.
Development of technical, communication, and project management skills in a supportive and mission-driven team.


Compensation: Internship, ($25/hr at 20-hrs per week)

The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or pregnancy-related conditions, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics, natural or protective hairstyle, military status, immigration status, English language proficiency, or any other factor prohibited by law in its programs and activities. BPS does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to work or learn. If you require an accommodation pursuant to the ADA for the application process, please contact the Accommodations Unit at accommodations@bostonpublicschools.org.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are hiring for a Business Intelligence Analyst, who will be responsible for the design, creation and reporting of financial performance analysis for the Merchandising team serving approximately 400 convenience stores located from Maine to Texas.

This position will work in the Merchandising department, along with other internal teams and our external brand partners to maximize item sales, basket sales, transactions and profits across our promotions and loyalty platforms.

For over 90 years Global Partners LP has been delivering the energy our communities need to grow, move, and thrive. From Alltown Fresh, with its innovative chef-led creations and guest-focused retail experience, to our vast network of over 50 liquid energy terminals across the eastern seaboard and beyond, Global Partner’s integrated network of businesses delivers value day-in and day-out to our guests and customers across the US. At Global Partners we embrace the future, investing in the energy transition with initiatives like GlobalGLO and supporting the communities in which we operate with our charitable work.

We’re excited for the next 90 years at Global Partners and what innovative new ideas we can bring to our guests and customers in the future. We’re looking for passionate people with great ideas to contribute to our company’s future. If you’re motivated by what’s next, Global Partners can provide you the opportunities to push your career to the next level.

The Types of “Energy” You Bring 


Regularly required to influence cross-functional teams.
Receives limited direction and exercises independent judgement within the scope of their role


“Gauges” of Responsibility 


This role requires an excellent collaborator, communicator and analyst with hands-on data experience
Will work closely with the Finance Team to access our BPC financial system
Strong strategic, analytical and critical thinking skills; strong bias towards data-based decision making with the ability to break down complex problems and formulate plans
Ability to navigate large, complex datasets and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Fluent in coding language(s) to join various data sources to enhance data sets
Develop real-time data visualization dashboards using PowerBI and Tableau
Develop automated reports for internal teams
Monitor KPIs and performance to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Provide timely insights and analytical support to merchandising stakeholders to enable effective business decision-making, including Global’s retail pricing team; this will include assessing price sensitivity and margin opportunities/impact, and building models to support business cases
Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner


“Fuel” for You


Coins! We offer competitive salaries and opportunities for growth. We mean it! We have an amazing Talent Development Team who create trainings for growth and job development.
Health + Wellness - Medical, Dental, Visions and Life Insurance. Along with additional wellness support.
The Road Ahead – We offer 401k and a match component!
Professional Development - We provide tuition reimbursement; this benefit is offered after 6 months of service.
Give Back! We believe in community support. We know everyone gives in their own way, that’s why we offer paid volunteer time-off to you to help an organization of your choice.


The GPS of our Interview Process


First thing first, if you’re interested in the role, please apply.
A talent acquisition team member will review your resume in partnership with the hiring manager. If your experience would lend to this opportunity a recruiter will contact you.
We conduct “in-person” (ZOOM) interviews and provide additional interview information or other items needed at that time.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s Degree Required
5-7 years of previous work experience in quantitative and qualitative analysis
Knowledge in Advance analytics, retail transaction data, modeling
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Tableau, PowerPoint, Power BI)
Solid experience of Tableau and Power BI
Nice to have: SQL coding


We value passion and potential. If you are enthusiastic about a position and think you can make a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply even if you don't check every box. We embrace different perspectives, backgrounds and experiences.

Global Partners LP is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a company culture where ideas from all people help us grow, move and thrive. We embrace the diversity of all applicants and do not discriminate against race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. If you have a disability and need an accommodation to apply, please contact our recruiting department at 781-891-4000.


Disclaimer: At Global Partners, we don't use lie detector tests for any employment decisions. We follow all the rules and regulations, so we need to let you know: In Massachusetts, it's illegal to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment of continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Investment Platform
Description:
About Us

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 60 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

About The Role

The Position

Our global investment platform is comprised of over 700 investment professionals across six investment functions (Boutiques, Hedge Funds, Privates, Research, Science, Strategy, and Trading) in eight locations (Boston, Hong Kong, London, New York, Radnor, San Francisco, Singapore, and Tokyo).

Within the investment platform, we are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to partner with one of our investment Leadership Teams. The Analyst will be a member of the Investment Platform Business Intelligence team, part of the COO Function residing at the intersection of the investment functions. The group is building shared ‘Centers of Excellence’ to benefit all investment groups and ensure the platform is flexible and adaptable to changing client needs and market conditions. Located in Boston, the Analyst will report to the Associate Director, Business Intelligence.

Essential Skills

The following essential skills are required for the role:


Analytical approach to problem solving – The Analyst will serve an important role in providing the tools and framework needed to assess performance and investment skill. The ability to creatively develop new ways to track, analyze and understand the drivers of business success is required, along with the ability to put processes in place to support the ongoing production of insightful business intelligence tools. An ability to aggregate and synthesize timely and accurate data from multiple sources to drive insights is key. The ideal candidate will exhibit strong attention to detail with an ability to quickly spot and diagnose errors in work done by others in evaluating the skill and impact of our investors through data and analytics. Proficiency in Tableau is required.
Superior collaboration and influencing skills – The successful candidate will enjoy contributing to a highly collaborative environment. The Analyst will build strong trusting relationships internally with colleagues across not only the investment platform, but also business partners in IT, Product Management, Human Resources, Finance and InvesTech. The ability to provide a point of view and challenge the status quo is critical, as is the humility to admit mistakes and a desire to learn from others; s/he must recognize the benefits of diverse perspectives. The ability to clearly communicate (both verbally and in writing), integrate numerous viewpoints, and mobilize/influence across all levels of the organization is critical.
Growth mindset – The flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing as a Business Intelligence Analyst. The ideal candidate will have a global perspective and creative approach for thinking about innovation and the evolution of investment and business analytics within the broader asset management industry.



Responsibilities

Areas of responsibility will include but are not limited to:


Create, improve, and organize meaningful and timely management analytics to provide insight into the key drivers of our business success
Analyze investment performance results and attribution to understand the drivers of investment performance and to evaluate the skill and impact of our investment professionals
Perform various analyses to assist with complex strategic, transformational and growth initiatives
Leverage an understanding of the investment process in order to marshal the right resources to allow our investors to exceed the performance expectations of our clients most efficiently and effectively
Proactively improve processes and data flow across the investment platform; and
Assist with the year-end performance evaluation and peer review process.



Other Qualifications

Additional qualifications and characteristics include:


A minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience in a technical role, ideally working within financial or business services
Hands-on technical ability, including coding proficiency in languages and data visualization tools including, but not limited to, Tableau, SQL, and Python
An understanding of global capital markets and a keen interest in understanding the investment process
Superior organizational skills with a results orientation. The ability to manage, prioritize and complete multiple projects simultaneously is necessary
Ability to navigate stressful situations with poise; focused on being a calming presence, active listener, and pragmatic problem solver
Excellent business writing and Excel skills are required; and
Strong academic credentials; a Bachelor's degree is required.



Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMWTalentOperations@wellington.com.

Benefits

At Wellington Management, our approach to compensation is designed to help us attract, inspire and retain the best talent in our industry. We strive to pay employees fairly and competitively across all levels and roles. Our approach to compensation considers all aspects of total compensation; all employees are eligible to receive salary, variable compensation, and benefits. The base salary range for this position is:

USD 80,000 - 180,000

This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; role; skills and experience; certifications; and education. This range is an estimate, and further details on salary and total compensation aspects will be shared with candidates during the recruitment process.

Base salary is only one component of Wellington’s total compensation approach. Other rewards may include a discretionary Corporate Bonus and/ or Incentives, if eligible. In addition, we offer a comprehensive and high value benefit package to meet the unique needs of our employees and their families, and we are committed to fostering a flexible work environment that enables employees to thrive personally and professionally. Examples of our benefits include retirement plan, health and wellbeing, dental, vision, and pharmacy coverage, health savings account, flexible spending accounts and commuter program, employee assistance program, life and disability insurance, adoption assistance, back-up childcare, tuition/CFA reimbursement and paid time off (leave of absence, paid holidays, volunteer, sick and vacation time)

Within the investment platform, we are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to partner with one of our investment Leadership Teams. The Analyst will be a member of the Investment Platform Business Intelligence team, part of the COO Function residing at the intersection of the investment functions. The group is building shared ‘Centers of Excellence’ to benefit all investment groups and ensure the platform is flexible and adaptable to changing client needs and market conditions. Located in Boston, the Analyst will report to the Associate Director, Business Intelligence.

Essential Skills

The following essential skills are required for the role:

  • Analytical approach to problem solving – The Analyst will serve an important role in providing the tools and framework needed to assess performance and investment skill. The ability to creatively develop new ways to track, analyze and understand the drivers of business success is required, along with the ability to put processes in place to support the ongoing production of insightful business intelligence tools. An ability to aggregate and synthesize timely and accurate data from multiple sources to drive insights is key. The ideal candidate will exhibit strong attention to detail with an ability to quickly spot and diagnose errors in work done by others in evaluating the skill and impact of our investors through data and analytics. Proficiency in Tableau is required.
  • Superior collaboration and influencing skills – The successful candidate will enjoy contributing to a highly collaborative environment. The Analyst will build strong trusting relationships internally with colleagues across not only the investment platform, but also business partners in IT, Product Management, Human Resources, Finance and InvesTech. The ability to provide a point of view and challenge the status quo is critical, as is the humility to admit mistakes and a desire to learn from others; s/he must recognize the benefits of diverse perspectives. The ability to clearly communicate (both verbally and in writing), integrate numerous viewpoints, and mobilize/influence across all levels of the organization is critical.
  • Growth mindset – The flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing as a Business Intelligence Analyst. The ideal candidate will have a global perspective and creative approach for thinking about innovation and the evolution of investment and business analytics within the broader asset management industry.


Responsibilities

Areas of responsibility will include but are not limited to:

  • Create, improve, and organize meaningful and timely management analytics to provide insight into the key drivers of our business success
  • Analyze investment performance results and attribution to understand the drivers of investment performance and to evaluate the skill and impact of our investment professionals
  • Perform various analyses to assist with complex strategic, transformational and growth initiatives
  • Leverage an understanding of the investment process in order to marshal the right resources to allow our investors to exceed the performance expectations of our clients most efficiently and effectively
  • Proactively improve processes and data flow across the investment platform; and
  • Assist with the year-end performance evaluation and peer review process.


Other Qualifications

Additional qualifications and characteristics include:

  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience in a technical role, ideally working within financial or business services
  • Hands-on technical ability, including coding proficiency in languages and data visualization tools including, but not limited to, Tableau, SQL, and Python
  • An understanding of global capital markets and a keen interest in understanding the investment process
  • Superior organizational skills with a results orientation. The ability to manage, prioritize and complete multiple projects simultaneously is necessary
  • Ability to navigate stressful situations with poise; focused on being a calming presence, active listener, and pragmatic problem solver
  • Excellent business writing and Excel skills are required; and
  • Strong academic credentials; a Bachelor's degree is required.


Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? That’s ok. If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and welcome a chance to review your background. We are dedicated to building and maintaining a diversified workforce and considering a broad array of candidates with a variety of skill, workplace experiences, and backgrounds.

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMWTalentOperations@wellington.com.

Benefits

At Wellington Management, our approach to compensation is designed to help us attract, inspire and retain the best talent in our industry. We strive to pay employees fairly and competitively across all levels and roles. Our approach to compensation considers all aspects of total compensation; all employees are eligible to receive salary, variable compensation, and benefits. The base salary range for this position is:

USD 80,000 - 180,000

This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; role; skills and experience; certifications; and education. This range is an estimate, and further details on salary and total compensation aspects will be shared with candidates during the recruitment process.

Base salary is only one component of Wellington’s total compensation approach. Other rewards may include a discretionary Corporate Bonus and/ or Incentives, if eligible. In addition, we offer a comprehensive and high value benefit package to meet the unique needs of our employees and their families, and we are committed to fostering a flexible work environment that enables employees to thrive personally and professionally. Examples of our benefits include retirement plan, health and wellbeing, dental, vision, and pharmacy coverage, health savings account, flexible spending accounts and commuter program, employee assistance program, life and disability insurance, adoption assistance, back-up childcare, tuition/CFA reimbursement and paid time off (leave of absence, paid holidays, volunteer, sick and vacation time)

Title: Commercial Analytics Analyst 2
Description:
Why Hologic?

As Hologic continues to grow and evolve as a worldwide leader in women’s health, our business increasingly depends on the successful use of data and its application within our teams. To this end, Hologic’s Surgical Division recently announced the creation of the Business Intelligence & Data Analytics team. A newly created position on the team of Data Analyst will be a pivotal role in the success of both this new team and the Surgical Division more broadly.

The Data Analyst position will develop and deploy dynamic analytical models that identify key insights to address business challenges and opportunities. Working closely with the Surgical Division’s leadership team, these models will capture, analyze and enable action using data to drive decision-making with greater speed and enable scalability for future growth.

Candidates should have an intimate knowledge of data source design and management, and a strong understanding of how best to leverage, integrate, visualize, and communicate these sources in driving key insights and actions.

What to expect:


Work closely with Surgical division leadership and partners in IT to develop, build, and maintain commercial performance and forecast dashboards. These dashboards will primarily leverage Power BI and Salesforce visualization and customization.
Leverage disparate data sources and shape continuous evolution of data models for easy access to critical information, reporting, and analysis.
Direct data strategies and priorities in partnership with Surgical and IT leadership.
Developtraining tools that enable adoption, data literacy, and self-service accessibility for cross-functional stakeholders including sales, marketing, service and finance.
Influence organizational culture and promote accountability by measuring commercial performance against critical KPIs.
Identify and clearly communicate actionable insights from large data packages.
Drive efficiencies, standardization, and a streamlined approach for technical support of analytical / reporting needs.


What we expect:


Expertise in PowerBI, including data modeling, data analysis expressions (DAX), Power Query, and visual storytelling.
Proficiency with related other Microsoft data-enabling tools including SQL Server, Azure and Excel.
Familiarity with Oracle and Salesforce.
Relevant certifications in analytics tools or methodologies are advantageous.
Experience managing large datasets and applying statistical analysis methods.
Thought leadership and ability to influence culture through data-driven insights.
Strong organizational and project management skills, including ability to work across functions and lead analytical projects.
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and be a team player.


Education & Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, Statistics, or other Social Sciences discipline with an aptitude and training for quantitative analysis required.
2+ years of experience in an analytical support role required.
Prior marketing and/or commercial business industry experience required, healthcare sector experience is a plus.


The annualized base salary range for this role is $62,500 - 97,800 and is bonus eligible. Final compensation packages will ultimately depend on factors including relevant experience, skillset, knowledge, geography, education, business needs and market demand.

Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice:

Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.

Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.
